info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 31 at 9:32PM EDT until March 31 at 9:45PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN BERKS...SOUTHEASTERN LEHIGH...MONTGOMERY... NORTHWESTERN BUCKS AND CHESTER COUNTIES... At 931 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Springtown to Quakertown to near Souderton to Phoenixville to Oxford, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. Locations impacted include... West Chester, Norristown, Pottstown, Phoenixville, Lansdale, West Norriton, East Norriton, Coatesville, Westtown, Quakertown, Perkasie, Doylestown, Byram, Downingtown, Souderton, Bedminster, Kennett Square, Collegeville, Oxford and Royersford. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 303 and 332. Northeast Extension between mile markers 21 and 49. Interstate 76 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 327 and 329. Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 62 and 63. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with some of these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
